summary: This is an email chain from January 29, 2019, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, scheduling a brief update meeting regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence involves a Deputy Chief of the Public Corruption Unit and a contractor, indicating internal coordination on the Epstein case.

persons.name: Deputy Chief, Public Corruption Unit
persons.role: Deputy Chief, Public Corruption Unit, U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, offering time slots for a 'quick Epstein update' meeting.

events.title: Epstein Update Meeting Scheduling
events.description: Internal email correspondence within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to schedule a brief update meeting regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The email is dated January 29, 2019, indicating ongoing activity related to the Epstein case at that time.
The correspondence is internal to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The subject is scheduling a 'quick Epstein update', showing the case was an active topic of discussion within the office.
The primary sender is identified as the Deputy Chief of the Public Corruption Unit, suggesting the unit's involvement.
The document is a routine scheduling email, revealing little about the substantive details of the investigation.
